<h2> UCL Data Analytics (2017--2022)</h2>

[[Syllabus]](files/teaching/MSIN0010-syllabus.pdf)
[[Textbook:  Data Analytics with R]](https://rgreminger.github.io/MSIN0010book/)

This is a core first-year module in the BSc Management Science program. The goal is to introduce students to the ways in which organizations use data and analytics to create value. The class covers the theory of statistical inference and the application of statistical machine learning methods to management problems. Topics include probability, estimation and testing, linear regression, classification and regression trees, and k-means clustering. Students become proficient in R. 

<h2> UCL Marketing Science (2018-2022)</h2>

[[Syllabus]](files/teaching/MSIN0041-syllabus.pdf)

This is a core third-year module in the BSc Management Science program. The class introduces students to classic marketing frameworks --- e.g., the “4 Ps,” the "3 Cs", "STP" --- but through the lens of rigorous measurement. Students get exposure to HBS case studies, academic research papers, and real data sets that can be used to improve marketing practice. Examples of methods covered include discrete choice models, Bayesian hierarchical models, the Rubin causal model, and word embeddings.
